title: The heroic Jewish couple who miraculously smuggled 527 children to safety from WWII occupied France
text:
Irish author Emma Donoghue stumbled across the amazing story of the Marcel Network, and incorporated it into her newbook

I googled ‘Holocaust Nice’. I wanted the protagonist of my novel – a 79-year-old New Yorker investigating his roots – to go back to that Mediterranean city to find out how his mother had spent the ‘années noires’ of the Second World War (the dark years, as the French call them).

I was looking for Resistance activity with which a Catholic woman could plausibly have been involved. I tried again: ‘Holocaust Nice Riviera France children’. That’s when I found a reference to ‘Moussa and Odette Abadi, who created the Réseau Marcel (Marcel Network) in Nice. They saved 527 children...
